Title.evidence: Hemodynamic and Angiographic Outcomes in the Single Ventricle Reconstruction Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomized to receive either a modified Blalock-Taussig shunt (MBTS) or a right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt (RVPAS)

Participants.evidence: included 549 infants with single ventricle physiology

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either a modified Blalock-Taussig shunt (MBTS) or a right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt (RVPAS)

Objective.evidence: to compare interstage cardiac catheterization hemodynamic and angiographic findings between shunt types in infants undergoing the Norwood procedure

Method_Outcome.evidence: association with 12-month transplant-free survival was evaluated

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: This multicenter, randomized controlled trial included 549 infants

Number_Analysed.evidence: Pre-stage II catheterization data were analyzed for 389 subjects

Result_Outcome.evidence: MBTS subjects had lower coronary perfusion pressure (27mmHg vs. 32mmHg, P<0.001) and higher Qp:Qs ratio (1.1 vs. 1.0, P=0.009)
